holes.body: To avoid the fairway bunker on the left, you should aim for the right side of the fairway. As it is slightly uphill from the second shot to the green, you should play 1/2 a club longer.

It is advisable to avoid the deep bunker on the right-hand side of the fairway, so hit the tee-shot toward the left. As it is uphill from the second shot to the green, you should play half a club longer.

This is the longest par-5 hole. You should hit the tee shot as far right as possible, then send the second shot toward the left bunker in front of the green. From there it will be easy to go for the pin with your third shot.

The left-hand side of the course is hazardous all the way to the green.

You should aim at the bunker to the right of the green when you hit the tee shot. For your second shot, consider the hazard in front of the green.
Although this is the shortest par-3 hole, it has the long and wide green. It is advisable to check the location of the pin well to avoid a long and difficult putt.

This very long par-4 hole requires a long drive. You should hit the tee shot looking at the left end of the building in the distance. It is a good idea to hit your second shot a club longer than usual. A par is a good score on this hole.

You should hit the tee shot to the right of the fairway. If you hit your second shot to the right of the green, you can land on it in two shots, but an accurate lay-up shot has a better chance for a birdie.
This is an uphill hole. It is advantageous to hit longer than the actual distance and it is advisable to aim at the left side of the green while a voiding the big bunker to the right.
You should hit the tee shot over the fairway bunker on the right. As the fairways lopes downhill, you can hit the second shot from a shorter distance.

You should hit the tee shot straight down the middle to avoid the bunker on the left and the long rough on the right. So accuracy will be important here. As it is downhill, you should hit the second shot half a club shorter.
This par-4 has a large pond to the right. As there is plenty of space on the left-hand side of the fairway, you should aim for that area without being conscious of the hazard.

This relatively long hole slightly bends toward the left. It is ideal to hit the tee shot toward the middle of the fairway. As it is slightly uphill from the second shot to the green, you should choose about one club longer.

This par-3 is quite long. You must know the location of the pin and be careful in selecting clubs. As the green is very long and it is not easy to measure the distance when putting, you should putt with extreme care.

You should hit the tee shot to the right-hand side of the fairway. The green has a steep slope from top to bottom, so you should hit the second shot toward the slightly uphill green half a club longer.

All obstacles are on the left-hand side of the fairway. You should send the tee shot and second shot to the right of the center so that it will be easier to get on the green as you will be aligned with the green.

This is a long par-4. You should hit the tee shot toward the left-hand side of the fairway. If it is difficult to reach the green in two shots, hit the ball to the left-hand side of the green, approach and try to save par.
Check the wind. It is advisable to hit a club longer in consideration of the hazard and bunker in front of the green.

This par-5 has a large pond to the right of the fairway. You should send both the tee shot and second shot to the left of the center while avoiding the hazard to the right so that it will be easier to get on green.
